course.name: Game Theory Applications in Operations Management
course.description: Game theory is the analysis of situations in which the payoff of a decision maker depends not only on his own actions but also on those of others. It is a standard analytical tool in social sciences. This course is designed to introduce students to the basics of game theory and its applications in operations management. It aims to deepen studentsâ€™ understanding of strategic interaction between firms. This course consists of two parts. The first part introduces basic concepts about game theory, such as dominance, Nash equilibrium, backward induction, asymmetric information, adverse selection, and signaling. The second part introduces the classic literature in operations management to illustrate the concepts. Recently published papers are also discussed for students to gain an understanding of research trend.
